qas.question: By what date did Bush obtain the number of votes required to become the 2004 Republican nominee?
When did Bush accept the Republican nomination?
Whom did Bush want to stand beside him as Vice President?
Which two topics did Bush remain steadfast on, during his campaign?

answers.text: terrorism and building an ownership society

qas.question: In New York State, which party was the Bush/Cheney duo candidates of?
When did Dick Cheney get enough delegates to be nominated at the RNC?
When did Cheney accept the nomination?
In what city was Cheney nominated at the RNC in 2004?

plausible_answers.text: defending America against terrorism and building an ownership society

qas.question: What two themes did Cheney speak about often during his campaign?

plausible_answers.text: encouraging more people to buy their own health insurance

qas.question: What was one idea endorsed by Cheney in his 2004 speech?

context: On <a0_0><b5_0>March 10, 2004<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Bush officially clinched the number of delegates needed to be nominated at the 2004 Republican National Convention in <b7_0>New York City<b7_0/>. Bush accepted the nomination on <a1_0><b6_0>September 2, 2004<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and selected Vice President <a2_0>Dick Cheney<a2_0/> as his running mate. (In New York, the ticket was also on the ballot as candidates of the <a4_0>Conservative Party<a4_0/> of New York State.) During the convention and throughout the campaign, Bush focused on two themes: <b8_0>defending America against <a3_0>terrorism and building an ownership society<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The ownership society included allowing people to invest some of their Social Security in the stock market, increasing home and stock ownership, and <b9_0>encouraging more people to buy their own health insurance<b9_0/>.
